topics.body:
No offense pokemon fans, but the first few series of digimon were *WAY* better than the pokemon anime *cough* tamers *cough*.

The pokemon movie was way better than the digimon movie; mewtwo killed the shit out of a bunch of people and was still considered kid appropriate movie.

After pokemon's indigo league that's when Ash's stupidity started wearing off on people cause every episode centers around how big of a idiot ash is.

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559cb5ac6368720b9d0003e8#post_559cb5ac6368720b9d0003e8
the first few episodes of pokemon are actually pretty great, seeing Ashs relationship with Pikachu, Brock and Misty develop for the first time as well as meeting Team Rocket for the first time is quite entertaining, but then as soon as the formula settles in its all downhill from there. some of the movies still hold up okay but nothing else is really too memorable

topics.body: I think Yo-kai watch is a better anime than pokemon (At least at the moment) because while It's formulaic, It's much better suited for being formulaic. (Something happens, Keita blames a Yo-kai for it, He's right, Shenanigans which end with the Yo-kai being befriended)

topics.body:
"@MoogSourceVermona":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559cb68463687255f8000c29#post_559cb68463687255f8000c29
When they got rid of Brock and Misty is when the series went downhill fast.

Remember when Ash would have entire conversations with Pikachu?

It may be blasphemy, but the pokemon anime would have been drastically better if instead of focusing solely on ash the shows were tie-ins to the video games; like a black & white anime or such.

topics.body:
Call me crazy, but I think digimon might make a comeback; cybersleuth is actually pretty okay as a rpg game; the main problem with it is it's a low budget game where there's very obvious corners they cut (I think famitsu gave it a 34/40)

And they're bringing back the original digidestined and appear to just be abandoning the trainwrecks the later generations were.  Frontier is where the franchise went down cause the amount of reused footage was grating; hell even the boss fights had re-used stock footage.  the story was meh, but the nail in the coffin was a massive chunk of the animation was rehashed all over the point.  If they hadn't of done that then the popularity wouldn't have fallen so rapidly.

Tl:dr; The games are getting good again.  Frontier is when digimon started falling in popularity cause the bad animation was painful to watch.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
